reviewText:
This is an interesting tech demo -- sort of.  There are a few things that need to be done before this app is really ready for prime time.

This is delivered as a folder.  In the folder, there are two separate Unity executables for each of six environments.  And then there's an additional batch file to support DirectX 11.  It requires installation of a specific CODEC pack from GitHub in order to operate, and overall is at a quality similar to the Multiplayer Theater demo that is available for free.

At the very least, take half an hour, write a launcher.  Put a button to download the required CODEC pack, have Steam launch that by default.

Use Environment.GetSpecialFolder and ask for videos -- look for the movies there.  If you're not going to do that, then at least use a single movies folder for all the environments.  But using the folder under Steam versus the user's Video folder (or any user specified folder) is something that is going to annoy users.

Think about if you really need 12 separate executables here -- that cannot be pleasant to maintain in Unity.  Those scenes can all be in a single executable, and you can use LoadLevel to load the level you want.  So instead of separate executables, make one executable.

At that point you need a menu -- there are a lot of good Oculus-enabled menus in the Unity asset store, and the default Unity UI is workable as well.  Basically, if you're going to ask for money you need to be a cut above the tech demos in the forums, for free, at the Oculus forums.

Keep in mind, Oculus is currently a developer only club -- developers are going to hold you to a higher standard than traditional users may, usually, and are going to have seen the various demos on the Oculus site most likely.  I know it's the first thing that I did after I unboxed my Oculus -- install the SDK, look at what people are uploading, see hey
date: I should do that."\n\nThis is not currently ready for prime time
recommended: and needs some work before it will be.  As a demo on GitHub
hoursPlayed: I'd recommend it.  As a commercial paid product
voteText: it needs some basic professionalism brought to the table."

reviewText:
HTC VIVE Review:

I put off buying CINEVEO for quite some time because of all the thumbs down you see right on the front page (Something I think needs to be handled differently on the steam store). However, I finally decided to give it a shot.... And MAN am I glad I did!

The screen clearity is fantastic, plays smoothly and works wonderfully. At first I thought they enviroments would get in the way of the movie experience, but when I'm watching movies, game videos i've downloaded, and other stuff: I hardly notice the backgrounds.

You can also zoom way in when using a specific enviroment to make the movie cover your entire view. With this setting it's very emerssive. I'd say this is a great buy! If you're having issues playing a movie, right-click the game in your library and select the manual, it has some great tips. Don't worry, it's nothing complicated, it's simply changing a check box from one thing to another.

reviewText:
This is a nice video player, but it has a few issues that prevent it from being great.

1. Does not work without internet(regardless of steam being in offline mode), which makes no sense to me as one of its selling points is the ability to play local content. Bit of a serious oversight IMO. Would have been nice to know this upfront before purchasing, as it really hindered my ability to give a demo.

2. Controls are a bit sensitive, when inside VR. Trying to navigate around through various local directories, can be a bit frustrating. Would be nice if it supported the wireless hand controller with the oculus rift.

Update(from Cineveo)Regarding your point #2. The VR File Browser" can also be navigated using the keyboard arrow keys (up

reviewText:
First let me preface this by stating I have been using Cineveo since the beginning back with the Oculus DK2. It was an amazing product back then and worked extremly well. Now I have a HTC Vive and I still use Cineveo for 3D movie playback.

The different movie theaters offer a nice selection to pick from and the multiplayer theater is a nice little addition seeing other people moving there heads around, looking about.

Most of the people complaining that Cineveo does not play XXX format. My videos do not start, ect. Are simply not following instructions. There is a little setup required with Cineveo. Out of about 400+ Videos and 20+ 3D Videos I have yet to find one that will not play in Cineveo. Simply put if you can run the video already on your computer then there is ZERO reason Cineveo can not play it.

reviewText:
N.B. Time Played does not reflect my actual use. I have had the non steam version for a while now.....

Love this product and so happy its now available as something that can be added to my steam library. Since I started watching my movies through this on my Oculus DK2 I really have trouble even thinking about just going back to watching movies on a standard flat screen.
Its hard to explain it if you have never used an Oculus , but when you watch movies using Cineveo it really is like being at the movies watching your favorite films on a big screen. And just like the movies , if you pick a seat right up front you will have to look left and right to catch all the action lol.

The different enviroments are great too , although myself I tend to stick to the classic big screen cinema room but I did have a laugh watching Gravity 3D while using the space station setting.
I do tend to get quite drawn in when using my oculus to the point I forget I am wearing it sometimes. I keep a drink behind me on a shelf while watching films and I often catch myself turning around expecting to see it sitting there lol.
The handsfree interface is a great feature too , being able to navigate without having to remove the rift is a bonus.

Few things to mention to offset a couple of the negative reviews.

1) You dont need to use shortcuts to start the different enviroments , this can be done by right clicking cineveo in steam and picking which one you want to launch.

2) Yes you need a codec pack but all are free and chances are if you watch movies from the internet then you already have a codec pack installed.

Overall its a great movie watching program for Oculus users so thumbs up from me !!! :D
voteText: 11 of 23 people (48%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
8/10

DK2 w/ runtime 0.7 , GTX 980 [Only have access to 4D Movie Theater 3.0 Beta]

PROS:
Theatre is well made (graphically pleasing) + ambient lighting that is linked to the image on screen is great
No Need to use keyboard and mouse everything can be navigated with gaze detection
Smooth Experience no judder at all
Subtitle Support

CONS:
0.7 runtime is very limited at the moment still waiting for update (cannot choose other theaters except main beta version)
There was one tvshow that started with low frame rate only on the screen not the theatre and took about 10 minutes to become smooth again
You have to boot the theater instead of selecting one in the application seems like friction in the User Experience (have to choose one when right clicking in steam)
Navigating menus inside the application to find the folder where you have your movies/shows is a bit tedious. Also if the movie or folder name is long it will be cut off without no option to see the rest. Makes episode finding difficult

Other than the organization structure of the menu. This application is very functional and frankly the best one out even with all the shortcomings. Also its the only movie theatre VR application that works with the latest oculus runtime as of now (10/1/2015). 10 dollars is a fair price but I just wish there was more organization when selecting media. If it had the same metadata structure as plex, this app would be hard to beat. In conclusion its simple, effective and great app with loads of potential.

reviewText:
I tested this software before it was on Steam. I know the majority of its updates and upgrades over time. This review is about the Steam version.

In summary i recommend this game because it's one of the best virtual reality cinema and is continuously update adding more themes, improvements or fixing bugs

Pros
+ Six different styles of cinemas. Each one with their only graphics and atmosphere. The 4D Cinema has lights that changes color depending of the video (4D ambient light)
+ Supports multiple video format. They recommend LAV Filter for maximum performance and quality. For the moment it doesn't support (yet) m2ts videos
+ Navigation with the head is simple and intuitive. With exception of some options (like enable 3D, restart viewport, etc), the majority of the functions doesn't require keyboard interaction.
+ Subtitle support, but for the moment only in SRT format.

Cons
- Each cinema has their own folder to storage videos. Although you can select any folder in your computer without using the movies folder.
- Doesn't support long file names. File names in the movies folder only shows the first 13 characters. In the folder navigation it shows 20.
- You can't change skin ingame, you need to close and then select another theme.
- It only show the first four videos in the movies folder.

reviewText:
Watching 3D movies (or just 2D movies really) is a killer app for VR headsets (if you have a strong neck), and CinveVeo is a great way to do it.
(I have had it for more than half a year before it has arrived on Steam)

It really works, and they have done tons of updates over time that have really refined the product (which makes it great that it is on Steam now, easy updates).
As an example, tharcod complained in his review that launching the app was amateurish, and boom one day later they fixed that by offering more launch options from Steam directly (okay, they should have done that from the start of course...).

I actually agreed with almost everything tharcod says otherwise in his negative review. The launching is improved already, but that you have to actively have to read through an entire manual to see how to install the necessary codecs is also not a good first experience (I can understand they can't include those codecs, but come on give a 5 line text-file with just the actions you need to do).

The actual movie selection is really hard too, that is actually what I would like to see improved most. In movie the shortcuts are very good though (as in you can easily control the movie viewing experience once you know the keys).

When I bought it in August 2014 I looked at several players and back then this was the only one that worked. I don't know how the app-landscape has changed since then, because I did not need to look, because CineVeo works for me (also because I don't use it that often admittedly).

reviewText:
I have been using this for quite some time before it appeared on Steam scince release.
It has grown and added more features as it will no doubt continue to scpecialy as the release of the Rift draws closer, with other VR devices on the way as well.

It is good for what it is and plays movies great it could do with a better ingame menu system rather than all these seperate exe files just to make things easier for both user and developer.

This could do with a better installer so the end user doesnot have to do any work, in my experiance this is what will end up causing most problems as not every one can follow instructions no matter how clear they are.

I have found other players that do as good of a job or better at playing high res 3D movies and are easier to use I wont drop thier names here but they are not on Steam yet and donot have the multiplayer that this has.

Being able to see the outside world throu a webcam with out taking off the Rift is awesome and a must to maintain immersion

Overall this is great and I hope to see it progress and do well

Is it worth the money thats asked for it, hmm well thats up to you and how much dissposable income you have.
Personaly I like it and think it was worth it

If you want to help support the developers of software that you are going to want to use on your Rift or other VR device then this is the perfect opportunity.

Play's all file types I have thrown at it such as MKV or MP4 with ease even super dupper double resolution 3840x1080 3D SBS MKV's play like butter.

You need to find a very comfortable seating possition not your PC chair to watch movies you will be siting still for a long time with a HMD attatched you your face making it difficult to enjoy munchies and drinks. As you watch your movies maybe consider having a half time break to do these things rather than knocking them all over the place and making a mess.
